What are my rights as a victim in court?

  • Stalking (Opens in new window) This will open (www.police.qld.gov.au) Stalking is a criminal offence and can include following, watching, contacting or leaving items for another person which causes the other person to be fearful. Find out more.
  • Elder abuse Elder abuse is any act within a relationship of trust which harms an older person. Learn about the types of abuse and the warning signs that elder abuse may be occurring.
  • Child abuse Find out about the physical, sexual, emotional, and neglectful types of child abuse and the myths and facts you need to be aware of.
  • Child sexual abuse Child sexual abuse is when an adult, a stronger child or a teenager involves a child in sexual activity. Find out about the signs of child sexual abuse and how to act to keep a child safe.
  • Sexual abuse and assault Sexual assault is a serious crime that includes any act of unwanted sexual behaviour towards another person. Learn about different types of sexual violence, assault and abuse.
  • Assault, sexual assault and stalking These are all classed as offences and are considered very serious crimes. Read the definitions and find out about maximum penalties for these offences.
  • Torture and trauma If you or someone you care about has experienced torture or trauma, there is help available. Learn about the effects of torture or trauma and where to get support.

Who to call to get help

In an emergency call the police on triple zero (000).

DVConnect Womensline

1800 811 811

DVConnect Mensline

1800 600 636

1800RESPECT

1800 737 732
